intro: Macaranga decaryana, commonly known as the white-veined macaranga, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with prominent white veins. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Macaranga decaryana is also known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
